frame.name: Launch_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts to begin the life of a <fex name="Process">Process</fex>.
<ex><fex name="Time">After discovering her knack for organization</fex>, <fex name="Agent">she decided to try to </fex> <t>launch</t> <fex name="Process">a career in human resources</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">The City of Bratislava</fex> has <t>launched</t> <fex name="Process">a pilot project of providing internet access in the city centre</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Process
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Process</fen> is initiated. </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is for the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor responsible for starting the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>To what end the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Subevent
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the first <fen>Subevent</fen> of the started <fen>Process</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Epistemic_stance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE modifies the target to indicate the legal- or "by rule" domain within which the event if initiating the <fex name="Process">Process</fex> is considered true.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason why or the way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world at the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> produces the <fen>Process</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Consecutive
FE.definition: <def-root>A consecutive event to the starting of the <fen>Process</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>The party for who's benefit the <fen>Process</fen> is launched. </def-root>

FE.name: Re_encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re_encoding, but not necessarily</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Process</fen> is launched.</def-root>
